channel.title: Having a strange issue :/
channel.description:
Ok so i use to host a server back in the day, and now that im running on wireless its not working i have a no-ip my port is forwarded to 43594 (i even got my .bat to auto port forward just encase) i downlaoded the ip duc and it says its running... but i try to connect it says "error connecting to server" when i run my .bat it says "automatically port forwarding... automatic port forward complete. Starting server on 0.0.0.0:43594" i can connect with 127.0.0.1 but my ip, and my no-ip doesnt work
o and its on my exceptions list on my firewall

item.title: Having a strange issue :/
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

i went to
http://www.canyouseeme.org/
to see if my port was forwarded and when i put 43594 in it said
Error: I could not see your service on xx.xx.xx.xxx on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out

this is a screenshot of my virtual server lsit

wkqv00.png694×288

Read full topic

item.title: Having a strange issue :/

item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

are you changing your client to connect to your no-ip?

item.title: Having a strange issue :/
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

Ok so i use to host a server back in the day, and now that im running on wireless its not working
i have a no-ip
my port is forwarded to 43594 (i even got my .bat to auto port forward just encase)
i downlaoded the ip duc and it says its running…
but i try to connect it says
“error connecting to server”
when i run my .bat it says
“automatically port forwarding…
automatic port forward complete.
Starting server on 0.0.0.0:43594”
i can connect with 127.0.0.1
but my ip, and my no-ip doesnt work

o and its on my exceptions list on my firewall
